result.execSummary:
The defendant Sedan M Smith Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by 8/16/2017, to be taken from the cash bail on deposit.

*Court orders defendant to pay the fine in Case No. 12CM5244. Defendant to pay $100.00 by 2/16/2017. Defendant to pay the remaining balance due 8/16/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and church. Court allows defendant to serve sentence on Electronic Monitoring. Defendant to report by 2/21/2017 by 5:00 p.m.
*Court will allow for expungement if defendant has no new arrests and has paid the fine in Case No. 12CM5244.

records.addlTxt: Court will allow for expungement if defendant has no new arrests and has paid the fine in Case No. 12CM5244.
Court resinstates the $500.00 cash bail previously forfeited on 10/4/2016.

Defendant Sedan M Smith in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Sedan M Smith in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sedan M Smith in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sedan M Smith in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sedan M Smith in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
